channel.title: NASA Breaking News
channel.description: A RSS news feed containing the latest NASA news articles and press releases.

item.title: NASA Science, Cargo Heads to Space Station on Northrop Grumman Resupply Mission
item.description: A Northrop Grumman Cygnus resupply spacecraft is on its way to the International Space Station with nearly 8,000 pounds of scientific investigations, technology demonstrations, commercial products, and other cargo after launching at 9:16 p.m. EDT Friday from NASA’s Wallops Flight Facility on Wallops Island, Virginia.

item.title: NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station to Answer Questions from High School Students
item.description: NASA astronaut Chris Cassidy, currently aboard the International Space Station, will answer questions posed by high school students from across the nation this week.

item.title: NASA Awards Launch Services Contract for IMAP Mission
item.description: NASA has selected Space Exploration Technologies (SpaceX) of Hawthorne, California, to provide launch services for the agency’s Interstellar Mapping and Acceleration Probe (IMAP) mission, which includes four secondary payloads.

item.title: NASA Awards Civil Engineering Contract
item.description: NASA has selected AECOM Technical Services Inc. of Orlando, Florida; Infrastructure Solution Service of Viera, Florida; and Jones Edmunds & Associates Inc. of Titusville, Florida; to provide architecture-engineer services for civil engineering infrastructure, equipment, and facilities at the agency’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida and other locati

item.title: NASA Report Details How Agency Significantly Benefits US Economy
item.description: NASA released Friday the results of its first-ever agencywide economic impact report. The report shows that, through all NASA activities, the agency generated more than $64.3 billion in total economic output during fiscal year 2019, supported more than 312,000 jobs nationwide, and generated an estimated $7 billion in federal, state, and local taxes

item.title: NASA Invites Media, Public to Watch Cargo Launch to Space Station
item.description: NASA commercial cargo provider Northrop Grumman is targeting 9:16 p.m. EDT Friday, Oct. 2, for the launch of its 14th resupply mission to the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA Invites Media to Hot Fire Test for Mega Rocket to Support Moon Missions
item.description: Media accreditation is now open for NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket Green Run hot fire test – the test of the rocket’s core stage and all of its integrated systems before its flight on the Artemis I lunar mission, scheduled for 2021.

item.title: NASA Invites Students to Join the Artemis Generation at SciFest Virtual Event
item.description: Venture with NASA to discover the future of flight, understand the portrait of planet Earth, and take the next steps in exploration at SciFest, the virtual STEM expo from the USA Science and Engineering Festival

item.title: NASA to Provide Update on Agency’s First Asteroid Sample Collection Attempt
item.description: NASA is hosting a media teleconference at 3 p.m. EDT Thursday, Sept. 24, to provide an update on the agency’s first attempt to contact the surface of asteroid Bennu and collect a sample next month.

item.title: NASA, US Space Force Establish Foundation for Broad Collaboration
item.description: While advancing plans for unprecedented lunar exploration under the Artemis program, NASA also is building on a longstanding partnership with the Department of Defense with a new memorandum of understanding announced today by NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine and U.S. Space Force (USSF) Chief of Space Operations Gen. John “Jay” Raymond.
